alert.note: Alert for Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:42AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN ADAMS, SOUTHWESTERN HOCKING, PIKE, NORTHWESTERN SCIOTO AND EASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 330 AM EDT... At 242 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Logan Elm Village to near Peebles, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Waverly, Piketon, Peebles, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, North Folk Village, Londonderry, Beaver, Sinking Spring, Wakefield, Pike County Airport, Mooresville, Omega, Locust Grove, Givens, South Bloomingville, Knockemstiff, Mount Joy and Massieville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
